# Definitions
[italic]These definitions are used throughout the rest of Marine Law.[/italic]
\n
[color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] or [color=#008000][bold]Acting Commander[/bold][/color] - The current [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] of an operation. - Transferable to a new [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], per the [textlink="Chain of Command" link="RMCCommandChain"].
If the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] is rendered incapable of command [bold]temporarily[/bold], the [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] inherits [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] rights, but should the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] return, they are still the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. This includes but is not limited to:
- Prolonged communications outage. - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] deploying in the field.
If the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] is rendered [bold]permanently[/bold] incapable of command, the next in the [textlink="Chain of Command" link="RMCCommandChain"] becomes the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], rather than becoming a [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color]. This includes but is not limited to: - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] is relieved of duty due to [bold]arrest[/bold] or [bold]mutiny[/bold]. - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] becoming [bold]unrevivable[/bold].
\n
[color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] - The ranking officer in the [textlink="Chain of Command" link="RMCCommandChain"] who, in the temporary absence of the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], is placed in command of the warship. - Unless explicitly stated otherwise, the [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] is interchangeable with, and inherits the rights of [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] in this case.
\n
[color=#ff000d][bold]MP/Law Enforcement[/bold][/color] - Military Police and Law Enforcement officers including personnel validly deputized by the [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], who deal with the UCMJ.
\n
[bold]Officer[/bold] - A person who holds the rank of Commissioned or Warrant Officer. These rights cannot be transferred.
\n
[bold]High Command[/bold] - Higher ranks of your faction than are available in the game normally, typically reachable by fax. Usually controlled by an admin.
\n
[bold]Flight Crew[/bold] - Designated Pilots and Dropship Crew Chiefs.
\n
[bold]Aiding, abetting, conspiring[/bold] - Assisting others in committing a crime, directly or indirectly, encouraging them to commit one (including bribery), conspiring or attempting to commit a crime will be treated as having committed that crime with regards to punishment.
\n
[bold]Lawful Orders[/bold] - Personnel are required to follow all lawful orders from their superiors and are NOT-required to follow unlawful orders. - If personnel are refusing to follow an order, they must state why they believe it would break the UCMJ, making it an unlawful order. - Valid NJPs are not unlawful orders in the case of neglected duties.
\n
[bold]Riot equipment[/bold] - Flashbangs. - Teargas. - Riot shotguns with beanbag rounds. - Riot shields and armor. - Riot grenade launchers.
\n
[bold]FOB[/bold] - The Forward Operating Base. - Designated by the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. It is usually a reinforced area, usually being the primary landing zone. - FOBs do not have to be placed adjacent to a landing zone.
\n
[bold]Area of Operations (AO)[/bold] - The area of operations is the broad location where personnel are being deployed to conduct an operation (the entire groundside map).
\n
[bold]Field Hospital[/bold] - It is a reinforced area, where there has been no recent combat or threats. - It must be designated as a [bold]Secure Area.[/bold]
\n
[bold]Alert Levels[/bold] - Code [bold][color=lightgreen]Green[/color][/bold]: All clear. - Code [bold][color=lightblue]Blue[/color][/bold]: Potentially hostile activity. - Code [bold][color=red]Red[/color][/bold]: There is an immediate threat to the ship/base or it's personnel. Examples of usage include; AI Core Security issue, biohazard containment breach, general quarters. Distress beacon, evacuation, and usage of sentry systems authorized. - Code [bold][color=black]Delta[/color][/bold]: Immediately applies if a warship hull has a major breach by intruders or there are enemy combatants within the base/ship. This is also alternatively known as 'Charlie In The Wire'
